metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9120 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the ion_ioctl function in drivers/staging/android/ion/ion.c in the Linux kernel before 4.6 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) by calling ION_IOC_FREE on two CPUs at the same time. It was discovered that a race condition leading to a use-after-free existed in the ION driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> at the bare minimum, this was introduced in c30707be128e952ca2ba77417cb5509e254a4aac, when the ion driver was added. we do not enable the staging ION android driver in either 3.13 or 4.4.

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
